# cardx

The **{cardx}** package is an extension of the {cards} package,
providing additional functions to create Analysis Results Data Objects
(ARDs) using the **R** programming language. The {cardx} package exports
ARD functions that uses utility functions from {cards} and statistical
functions from additional packages (such as, {stats}, {mmrm}, {emmeans},
{car}, {survey}, etc.) to construct summary objects.

Summary objects can be used to:

- **Generate Tables and visualizations for Regulatory Submission**
  easily in **R**. Perfect for presenting descriptive statistics,
  statistical analyses, regressions, etc. and more.

- **Conduct Quality Control checks on existing Tables** in R. Storing
  both the results and test parameters supports the re-use and
  verification of data analyses.

## Installation

Install cards from CRAN with:

``` r

install.packages("cardx")
```

You can install the development version of cards from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("insightsengineering/cardx")
```

## Examples

### Example ARD Creation

Example t-test:

``` r

library(cardx)

cards::ADSL |>
  # keep two treatment arms for the t-test calculation
  dplyr::filter(ARM %in% c("Placebo", "Xanomeline High Dose")) |>
  cardx::ard_stats_t_test(by = ARM, variable = AGE)
```

``` R
## {cards} data frame: 14 x 9

##    group1 variable   context   stat_name stat_label      stat
## 1     ARM      AGE stats_t_…    estimate  Mean Dif…     0.828
## 2     ARM      AGE stats_t_…   estimate1  Group 1 …    75.209
## 3     ARM      AGE stats_t_…   estimate2  Group 2 …    74.381
## 4     ARM      AGE stats_t_…   statistic  t Statis…     0.655
## 5     ARM      AGE stats_t_…     p.value    p-value     0.513
## 6     ARM      AGE stats_t_…   parameter  Degrees …   167.362
## 7     ARM      AGE stats_t_…    conf.low  CI Lower…    -1.668
## 8     ARM      AGE stats_t_…   conf.high  CI Upper…     3.324
## 9     ARM      AGE stats_t_…      method     method Welch Tw…
## 10    ARM      AGE stats_t_… alternative  alternat… two.sided
## 11    ARM      AGE stats_t_…          mu    H0 Mean         0
## 12    ARM      AGE stats_t_…      paired  Paired t…     FALSE
## 13    ARM      AGE stats_t_…   var.equal  Equal Va…     FALSE
## 14    ARM      AGE stats_t_…  conf.level  CI Confi…      0.95

## ℹ 3 more variables: fmt_fun, warning, error
```

Note that the returned ARD contains the analysis results in addition to
the function parameters used to calculate the results allowing for
reproducible future analyses and further customization.

### Model Input

Some {cardx} functions accept regression model objects as input:

``` r

lm(AGE ~ ARM, data = cards::ADSL) |>
  ard_aod_wald_test()
```

Note that the [Analysis Results
Standard](https://www.cdisc.org/standards/foundational/analysis-results-standard)
should begin with a data set rather than a model object. To accomplish
this we include model construction helpers.

``` r

construct_model(
  data = cards::ADSL,
  formula = reformulate2("ARM", response = "AGE"),
  method = "lm"
) |>
  ard_aod_wald_test()
```

``` R
## {cards} data frame: 6 x 8

##      variable   context stat_name stat_label     stat fmt_fun
## 1 (Intercept) aod_wald…        df  Degrees …        1       1
## 2 (Intercept) aod_wald… statistic  Statistic 7126.713       1
## 3 (Intercept) aod_wald…   p.value    p-value        0       1
## 4         ARM aod_wald…        df  Degrees …        2       1
## 5         ARM aod_wald… statistic  Statistic    1.046       1
## 6         ARM aod_wald…   p.value    p-value    0.593       1

## ℹ 2 more variables: warning, error
```

## Additional Resources

- The best resources are the help documents accompanying each {cardx}
  function.
- Supporting documentation for both companion packages
  [{cards}](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cards/) and
  {[gtsummary](https://www.danieldsjoberg.com/gtsummary/index.html)}
  will be useful for understanding the ARD workflow and capabilities.

## {cardx} + {renv}

The {cardx} package exports functions to create ARDs based on various
statistical methods; methods that are primarily implemented in other
packages. {cardx} does not take a hard dependency on these packages,
meaning that these packages are not typically installed when {cardx} is
installed from CRAN. As a result, {renv} will not record these packages
in its `lock.file` unless there is a direct reference to the underlying
statistical package in your code. For example, if you pass a regression
model to
[`ard_emmeans_contrast()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_emmeans.md),
there is no direct reference to the {emmeans} package in your script and
{renv} will not record the package.

One can circumvent this issue by including some kind of reference to the
package in your code. Below are are couple of common ways to do so.

``` r

library(emmeans)
```

Attaching a package with
[`library()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/library.html) is great for its
simplicity, but you may not want to attach a package if it’s not
necessary.

``` r

invisible(emmeans::emmeans)
```

You can invisibly print a function from the package. Printing a function
does not have an effect on your environment (which is great), but it is
somewhat more difficult to read. (*This is my preferred method.*)

# Package index

## ARD Creation

### {stats} package

- [`ard_stats_anova()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_anova.md)
  : ARD ANOVA
- [`ard_stats_aov()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_aov.md)
  : ARD ANOVA
- [`ard_stats_chisq_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_chisq_test.md)
  : ARD Chi-squared Test
- [`ard_stats_fisher_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_fisher_test.md)
  : ARD Fisher's Exact Test
- [`ard_stats_kruskal_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_kruskal_test.md)
  : ARD Kruskal-Wallis Test
- [`ard_stats_mantelhaen_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_mantelhaen_test.md)
  : ARD Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel Chi-Squared Test
- [`ard_stats_mood_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_mood_test.md)
  : ARD Mood Test
- [`ard_stats_mcnemar_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_mcnemar_test.md)
  [`ard_stats_mcnemar_test_long()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_mcnemar_test.md)
  : ARD McNemar's Test
- [`ard_stats_oneway_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_oneway_test.md)
  : ARD One-way Test
- [`ard_stats_poisson_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_poisson_test.md)
  : ARD Poisson Test
- [`ard_stats_prop_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_prop_test.md)
  : ARD 2-sample proportion test
- [`ard_stats_t_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_t_test.md)
  [`ard_stats_paired_t_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_t_test.md)
  : ARD t-test
- [`ard_stats_t_test_onesample()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_t_test_onesample.md)
  : ARD one-sample t-test
- [`ard_stats_wilcox_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_wilcox_test.md)
  [`ard_stats_paired_wilcox_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_wilcox_test.md)
  : ARD Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test
- [`ard_stats_wilcox_test_onesample()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_stats_wilcox_test_onesample.md)
  : ARD one-sample Wilcox Rank-sum

### {aod} package

- [`ard_aod_wald_test()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_aod_wald_test.md)
  : ARD Wald Test

### {car} package

- [`ard_car_anova()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_car_anova.md)
  : ARD ANOVA from car Package
- [`ard_car_vif()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_car_vif.md)
  : Regression VIF ARD

### {effectsize} package

- [`ard_effectsize_cohens_d()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_effectsize_cohens_d.md)
  [`ard_effectsize_paired_cohens_d()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_effectsize_cohens_d.md)
  : ARD Cohen's D Test
- [`ard_effectsize_hedges_g()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_effectsize_hedges_g.md)
  [`ard_effectsize_paired_hedges_g()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_effectsize_hedges_g.md)
  : ARD Hedge's G Test

### {emmeans} package

- [`ard_emmeans_contrast()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_emmeans.md)
  [`ard_emmeans_emmeans()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_emmeans.md)
  : ARDs for LS Mean Difference and LS Means

### {smd} package

- [`ard_smd_smd()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_smd_smd.md)
  : ARD Standardized Mean Difference

### {survey} package

- [`ard_summary(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_summary.survey.design.md)
  : ARD Continuous Survey Statistics
- [`ard_tabulate(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_tabulate.survey.design.md)
  : ARD Categorical Survey Statistics
- [`ard_tabulate_value(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_tabulate_value.survey.design.md)
  : ARD Dichotomous Survey Statistics
- [`ard_missing(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_missing.survey.design.md)
  : ARD Missing Survey Statistics
- [`ard_attributes(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_attributes.md)
  : ARD Attributes
- [`ard_continuous_ci(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_continuous_ci.survey.design.md)
  : ARD survey continuous CIs
- [`ard_categorical_ci(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_categorical_ci.survey.design.md)
  : ARD survey categorical CIs
- [`ard_total_n(`*`<survey.design>`*`)`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_total_n.survey.design.md)
  : ARD Total N
- [`ard_survey_svychisq()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survey_svychisq.md)
  : ARD Survey Chi-Square Test
- [`ard_survey_svyranktest()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survey_svyranktest.md)
  : ARD Survey rank test
- [`ard_survey_svyttest()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survey_svyttest.md)
  : ARD Survey t-test

### {survival} package

- [`ard_survival_survfit()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survival_survfit.md)
  : ARD Survival Estimates
- [`ard_survival_survfit_diff()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survival_survfit_diff.md)
  : ARD Survival Differences
- [`ard_survival_survdiff()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_survival_survdiff.md)
  : ARD for Difference in Survival

### Other ARD functions

- [`ard_continuous_ci()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_continuous_ci.md)
  : ARD continuous CIs
- [`ard_categorical_ci()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_categorical_ci.md)
  : ARD Proportion Confidence Intervals
- [`ard_regression()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_regression.md)
  : Regression ARD
- [`ard_regression_basic()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_regression_basic.md)
  : Basic Regression ARD
- [`ard_tabulate_max()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_tabulate_max.md)
  : ARD to Calculate Categorical Occurrence Rates by Maximum Level Per
  Unique ID
- [`ard_incidence_rate()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_incidence_rate.md)
  : ARD Incidence Rate
- [`ard_tabulate_abnormal()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/ard_tabulate_abnormal.md)
  : ARD Abnormality Counts

## Helpers

- [`proportion_ci_wald()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`proportion_ci_wilson()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`proportion_ci_clopper_pearson()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`proportion_ci_agresti_coull()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`proportion_ci_jeffreys()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`proportion_ci_strat_wilson()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  [`is_binary()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/proportion_ci.md)
  : Functions for Calculating Proportion Confidence Intervals
- [`construct_model()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/construction_helpers.md)
  [`reformulate2()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/construction_helpers.md)
  [`bt()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/construction_helpers.md)
  [`bt_strip()`](https://insightsengineering.github.io/cardx/reference/construction_helpers.md)
  : Construction Helpers
